tool_description: Creates and manages detailed permission matrices mapping database resources to specific access rights and operations.

resource_type.description: Type of database resource: table, view, procedure, function, schema, database

grantee_type.description: Type of permission recipient: user, role, group

grantee_name.description: Name of the user, role, or group receiving permissions

grant_option.description: Whether grantee can grant these permissions to others

error_messages: Invalid resource type: Use one of [table, view, procedure, function, schema, database]
Resource not found: Specified resource does not exist in the database
Invalid permission: One or more permissions are not valid for the resource type
Invalid grantee type: Use one of [user, role, group]
Grantee not found: Specified user, role, or group does not exist
Permission already exists: This permission is already granted to the specified grantee
Invalid condition syntax: Check condition formatting and syntax
usage: Specify resource_type, resource_name, permissions array, grantee_type, and grantee_name. Optionally set grant_option, conditions, and expiration_date for advanced permission control.

permission_id.description: Unique identifier for the permission grant

effective_permissions.description: Complete list of effective permissions after inheritance
